title: GoAir flight makes emergency landing after engine trouble | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
GoAir flight makes emergency landing after engine trouble india Updated: Feb 14, 2017 17:44 IST PTI, New Delhi After initial inspection, the engine problem was being rectified by replacing a (engine) component, GoAir said.(File Photo) 
A New Delhi-bound GoAir flight from Mumbai with over 180 people on board made an emergency landing here following engine trouble. 
The aircraft, an Airbus A320 Neo, landed safely, GoAir said. 
This is the second incident involving a GoAir flight , where the plane had to make an emergency landing due to engine trouble. 
According to GoAir, the captain of its flight G8 329 from Mumbai to Delhi had sought priority landing from the Air Control Tower (ATC). 
“Due to a technical snag in the air bleed system, the flight commander had to reduce the power of the left engine and he asked for emergency assistance during landing,” the airline said. 
Read: Delhi residents spot ‘fire’ on GoAir flight, avert mishap 
The aircraft with 183 passengers and crew landed safely at 8.06am, it said. 
After initial inspection, the engine problem was being rectified by replacing a (engine) component, GoAir said. The aircraft will be cleared for operations after necessary ground checks. 
On February 8, a Bengaluru-bound GoAir flight, carrying around 190 people, had made an emergency landing at the Delhi Airport due to technical issues. tags
